How to report your ROAD, TRANSPORT AND TRAFFIC issues in Joburg

To make sure our city services work well, it's important to report problems like potholes, power cuts, water leaks, or fallen trees. Following up and taking more steps if needed can help fix these issues. Hereï¿½s how you can report these issues in Joburg.

Please read point 4 for reporting ROAD, TRANSPORT AND TRAFFIC issues in Joburg.

Steps for reporting issues

  1. Go to the Joburg eservices website to log a fault:
  • City of Joburg e-services
  1. Call the Joburg Call Centre:
  • Phone: 0860 56 28 74
  • Email: joburgconnect@joburg.org.za
  1. Register on Log Now Smart City:
  • Sign up at Log Now to report city problems and see FAQs.
  1. Report ROAD, TRANSPORT AND TRAFFIC issues:
Category What You Can Report Contact
Roads, transport and traffic Potholes Johannesburg Roads Agency (JRA)
Phone numbers:
- 011 298 5000
- 011 375 5555
- 0860 562 874
Email address:
- hotline@jra.co.za
- joburgconnect@joburg.org.za
Website:
Joburg Roads Agency (JRA) contacts
Pavements Johannesburg Roads Agency (JRA) Contact details same as above
Road markings and signage Johannesburg Roads Agency (JRA) Contact details same as above
Unsafe road surface Johannesburg Roads Agency (JRA) Contact details same as above
Storm water drains Johannesburg Roads Agency (JRA) Contact details same as above
Traffic lights Johannesburg Roads Agency (JRA) Contact details same as above
Streetlights Johannesburg Roads Agency (JRA) Contact details same as above
Public transport (Buses, Taxis, Trains) Go to the Joburg e-services website to log a fault or contact the Joburg Call Centre:
Phone number: 0860 56 28 74
Email: joburgconnect@joburg.org.za
